gen:link.label:label: Panel I
DBSBLRBLR1Consolidated_Layout1
Unweighted Amount
X010
Factor to be Multiplied
X020
Weighted Amount
X030
Level 1 Assets
1. Cash in hand
Y010
2. Excess CRR balance
Y020
3. Government Securities in excess of minimum SLR requirement
Y030
4. Government securities within the mandatory SLR requirement, to the extent allowed by RBI under MSF (presently to the extent of 2 per cent of NDTL as allowed for MSF)
Y040
5. Marketable securities issued or guaranteed by foreign sovereigns having 0% risk-weight under Basel II Standardised Approach (country-wise details to be provided under memo item no.1)
Y050
6. Facility to Avail Liquidity for Liquidity Coverage Ratio
Y060
7. Total Level 1 Assets (1+2+3+4+5+6)
Y070
8. Add amount lent under a reverse repo transaction undertaken for up to and including 30 days in repo-eligible non-Level 1 assets (irrespective of whether they qualify as Level 2 assets or not)
Y080
9. Deduct amount borrowed under a repo transaction undertaken for up to and including 30 days in repo-eligible non-Level 1 assets (irrespective of whether they qualify as Level 2 assets or not)
Y090
10. Total Adjusted Level 1 Assets (7+8-9)
Y100
Level 2 Assets
Level 2A Assets

11. Marketable securities representing claims on or claims guaranteed by sovereigns, Public Sector Entities (PSEs) or multilateral development banks that are assigned a 20% risk weight under the Basel II Standardised Approach for credit risk and provided that they are not issued by a bank/financial institution/NBFC or any of its affiliated entities. (issuer-wise details to be provided under memo item no.2)
Y110
12. Corporate bonds, not issued by a bank/financial institution/NBFC or any of its affiliated entities, which have been rated AA- or above by an Eligible Credit Rating Agency.
Y120

13. Commercial Papers not issued by a bank/ PD/financial institution or any of its affiliated entities, which have a short-term rating equivalent to the long-term rating of AA- or above by an Eligible Credit Rating Agency.
Y130
14. Total Level 2A Assets (11+12+13)
Y140
15. Add market value of repo-eligible Level 2A securities placed as collateral under a repo transaction undertaken for up to (and including) 30 days.
Y150
16. Deduct market value of repo-eligible Level 2A securities acquired as collateral under a reverse repo transaction undertaken for up to (and including) 30 days
Y160
17. Total Adjusted Level 2A Assets (14 +15-16)
Y170
Level 2B Assets
18. Marketable securities representing claims on or claims guaranteed by sovereigns having risk weights higher than 20% but not higher than 50%
Y180
19. Common Equity Shares not issued by a bank/financial institution/NBFC or any of its affiliated entities and included in NSE CNX Nifty and/or S&P BSE Sensex indices
Y190
19A. Corporate debt securities (including commercial paper)
Y200
20. Total Level 2B Assets (18+19+19A)
Y210
21. Add market value of repo-eligible Level 2B securities placed as collateral under a repo transaction undertaken for upto (and including) 30 days.
Y220
22. Deduct market value of repo-eligible Level 2B securities acquired as collateral under a reverse repo transaction undertaken for upto (and including) 30 days.
Y230
23. Total Adjusted Level 2B Assets (20 + 21 -22)
Y240

24. Total Stock of HQLAs = Level 1 (Unadjusted)+Level 2A(Unadjusted)+Level 2B(Unadjusted)-Adjustment for 15% cap-Adjustment for 40% cap Where: Adjustment for 15% cap = Max (Adjusted Level 2B-15/85*(Adjusted Level 1+Adjusted Level 2A), Adjusted Level 2B-15/60*Adjusted Level 1, 0) Adjustment for 40% cap = Max ((Adjusted Level 2A+Adjusted Level 2B-Adjustment for 15% cap)-2/3*Adjusted Level 1 assets, 0) [Note-Only Weighted Amounts of various assets to be taken for this formula]
Y250
25. Adjustment in HQLA to reflect liquidity transfer restrictions
Y260
26. Consolidated Total Stock of HQLAs
Y270
High Quality Liquid Assets (HQLAs)

Y450
(i) Net derivative cash outflows
Y460

Y470

Y480
(iv) Increased liquidity needs related to the potential for valuation changes on non-Level 1 posted collateral securing derivatives
Y490
(v) Increased liquidity needs related to excess non-segregated collateral held by the bank that could contractually be called at any time by the counterparty
Y500
(vi) Increased liquidity needs related to contractually required collateral on transactions for which the counterparty has not yet demanded the collateral be posted
Y510
(vii) Increased liquidity needs related to derivative transactions that allow collateral substitution to non-HQLA assets
Y520
(viii) ABCP, SIVs, SPVs etc. maturing within the 30 days period [(a)+(b)]
Y530

Y540
(b) Asset Backed Securities applied to maturing amounts
Y550
(ix) Currently undrawn committed credit and liquidity facilities[2] provided to [(a)+(b)+(c)+(d)+(e)+(f)+(g)]
Y560
(a) Retail and small business clients
Y570
(b) Non-financial corporates, sovereigns and central banks, multilateral development banks, and PSEs-Credit facilities
Y580

Y590

Y600

Y610

Y620
(g) Other legal entity customers
Y630

Y640

Y650
(b) Revocable credit and liquidity facilities
Y670
(c) Any other
Y680

Y690
